intro: Erysimum rigens, commonly known as the rigid wallflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers are bright yellow with four petals arranged in a cross shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
